title: In a nod to Oppenheimer's legacy, US officials vow to prioritize cleanup at nuclear lab - The Associated Press
summary: The article discusses the challenges and increasing costs of cleaning up nuclear waste at Los Alamos National Laboratory, emphasizing the importance of properly tracking costs and progress for environmental cleanup activities.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562910 - Remediation Services, 562112 - Hazardous Waste Collection, 924110 - Administration of Environmental Quality Programs, 221119 - Other Electric Power Generation

title: Lighting Construction Jobsites in New Ways - For Construction Pros
summary: The article discusses the drawbacks of diesel-powered lighting in construction sites and presents alternative environmentally friendly lighting solutions like solar and battery-powered options, hydrogen fuel cells, and tethered drones. These alternatives aim to reduce carbon emissions, noise, and costs while providing better illumination and flexibility for construction sites.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is considered green innovation as it addresses the environmental impact of traditional diesel-powered light sources by introducing alternative lighting solutions that are more sustainable and eco-friendly.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article does not focus on introducing new or improved products or processes that significantly differ from previous solutions in the construction industry, but rather on transitioning to more sustainable lighting options.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses green products such as solar and battery-powered light towers that are designed and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle by minimizing emissions and noise, and requiring minimal maintenance.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights green processes in the construction industry by discussing alternative methods like solar power, batteries, and tethered drone technology that minimize environmental impacts, reduce emissions, and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 238210 - Electrical Contractors and Other Wiring Installation Contractors, 238990 - All Other Specialty Trade Contractors, 561730 - Landscaping Services, 561790 - Other Services to Buildings and Dwellings
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it transparently presents the drawbacks of traditional diesel-powered lighting and highlights alternative solutions for reducing environmental impacts in the construction industry.
